intro: Xantolis myrsinoides, commonly known as the red-flowered myrsin, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from white to deep red. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually elliptical with a glossy surface, and it produces berries that are edible for certain bird species. Xantolis myrsinoides plays a role in local ecosystems by supporting biodiversity through pollination and seed dispersal.
